id.description:
Unique numeric identifier for the dashboard.
TODO must isolate or remove identifiers local to a Grafana instance...?

uid.description: Unique dashboard identifier that can be generated by anyone. string (8-40)

editable.description: Whether a dashboard is editable or not.

time.description: Time range for dashboard, e.g. last 6 hours, last 7 days, etc

timepicker.description:
TODO docs
TODO this appears to be spread all over in the frontend. Concepts will likely need tidying in tandem with schema changes

collapse.description: Whether timepicker is collapsed or not.

enable.description: Whether timepicker is enabled or not.

hidden.description: Whether timepicker is visible or not.

schemaVersion.description:
Version of the JSON schema, incremented each time a Grafana update brings
changes to said schema.
TODO this is the existing schema numbering system. It will be replaced by Thema's themaVersion

version.description: Version of the dashboard, incremented each time the dashboard is updated.

dashboard.AnnotationQuery.description:
TODO docs
FROM: AnnotationQuery in grafana-data/src/types/annotations.ts

dashboard.DashboardCursorSync.description:
0 for no shared crosshair or tooltip (default).
1 for shared crosshair.
2 for shared crosshair AND shared tooltip.

fixedColor.description: Stores the fixed color value if mode is fixed

displayName.description: The display value for this field.  This supports template variables blank is auto

displayNameFromDS.description:
This can be used by data sources that return and explicit naming structure for values and labels
When this property is configured, this value is used rather than the default naming strategy.

path.description:
An explict path to the field in the datasource.  When the frame meta includes a path,
This will default to `${frame.meta.path}/${field.name}

When defined, this value can be used as an identifier within the datasource scope, and
may be used to update the results

writeable.description: True if data source can write a value to the path.  Auth/authz are supported separately

filterable.description: True if data source field supports ad-hoc filters

mappings.description: Convert input values into a display string

links.description: The behavior when clicking on a result

custom.description:
custom is specified by the PanelFieldConfig field
in panel plugin schemas.

type.description: Support for legacy graph and heatmap panels.

dashboard.Panel.description:
Dashboard panels. Panels are canonically defined inline
because they share a version timeline with the dashboard
schema; they do not evolve independently.

type.description: The panel plugin type id. May not be empty.

pluginVersion.description: FIXME this almost certainly has to be changed in favor of scuemata versions

transparent.description: Whether to display the panel without a background.

datasource.description: The datasource used in all targets.

links.description:
Panel links.
TODO fill this out - seems there are a couple variants?

repeat.description: Name of template variable to repeat for.

repeatDirection.description:
Direction to repeat in if 'repeat' is set.
"h" for horizontal, "v" for vertical.

thresholds.description: TODO docs - seems to be an old field from old dashboard alerts?

options.description:
options is specified by the PanelOptions field in panel
plugin schemas.

dashboard.Target.description:
Schema for panel targets is specified by datasource
plugins. We use a placeholder definition, which the Go
schema loader either left open/as-is with the Base
variant of the Dashboard and Panel families, or filled
with types derived from plugins in the Instance variant.
When working directly from CUE, importers can extend this
type directly to achieve the same effect.
